newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-BHP Steel to axe 250 jobs at Whyalla.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-BHP Steel to axe 250 jobs at Whyalla.

text.p: The Broken Hill Proprietary Co Ltd said on Tuesday it planned to cut about 250 jobs from its Whyalla integrated steel mill in South Australia by next April.
"The action is required to improve the current financial performance and is part of a programme to develop a business plan for a long-term viable Whyalla steelworks," BHP said in a statement.
The Whyalla plant produces 1.1 million tonnes of steel each year. The job cuts would leave it with a workforce of 2,100, a spokesman for the Whyalla steelworks, Les Jones, told Reuters.
The existing workforce is covered by a security of employment agreement and the job cuts would be achieved through voluntary severence packages, the statement said.

"The workforce reduction is one action amongst a range of initiatives designed to improve the business performance of Whyalla steelworks," it added, citing exploration, environmental and plant-upgrade initiatives.
